texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I stumbled upon a strange bug at work one day and found I couldn't connect to our wireless access points any longer. After some investigation in the systemd journal, I found that my card associated with the access point but never went any further past that. It looked as if the authentication wasn't ever taking place.
texts.text: I stumbled upon a strange bug at work one day and found I couldn't connect to our wireless access points any longer. After some investigation in the systemd journal, I found that my card associated with the access point but never went any further past that. It looked as if the authentication wasn't ever taking place.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: A quick dig through my recent dnf update history didn't reveal much but then I found a tip from a coworker on an internal wiki that wpa_supplicant 2.4 has problems with certain Aruba wireless access points.
texts.text: A quick dig through my recent dnf update history didn't reveal much but then I found a tip from a coworker on an internal wiki that wpa_supplicant 2.4 has problems with certain Aruba wireless access points.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There's an  open ticket on the Red Hat Bugzilla  about the issues in wpa_supplicant 2.4. The  changelog  for 2.4 is lengthy and it has plenty of mentions of  EAP ; Aruba's preferred protocol on certain networks. One of those changes could be related. A formal support case[^4] is open with Aruba as well.
texts.text: There's an  open ticket on the Red Hat Bugzilla  about the issues in wpa_supplicant 2.4. The  changelog  for 2.4 is lengthy and it has plenty of mentions of  EAP ; Aruba's preferred protocol on certain networks. One of those changes could be related. A formal support case[^4] is open with Aruba as well.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If this bug affects you, you can return to wpa supplicant-2.3-3.fc22.x86 64 easily by running:
texts.text: If this bug affects you, you can return to wpa supplicant-2.3-3.fc22.x86 64 easily by running:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This isn't a good long-term solution, but it fixes the bug and gets you back online.
texts.text: This isn't a good long-term solution, but it fixes the bug and gets you back online.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: [^4]: The support case is no longer accessible as of May 2021.
texts.text: [^4]: The support case is no longer accessible as of May 2021.
